noun.description: A person or animal that lays something again. Compare "re-lay"rare.

Railways (originally and chiefly US). As a mass noun: a length of rail too worn for heavy usage but which is suitable for re-laying on a line with lighter traffic. Chiefly attributive, especially in "relayer rail". Now rare.

origin: Mid 19th century. From re-lay + -er. Compare earlier layer<br>early 20th century; earliest use found in Eau Claire (Wisconsin) Leader. From relay + -er<br>1920s. From relay + -er. Compare French relayeur person in charge of a place for changing horses.
